subject: Dogfighting
lead_paragraph: The trial of Michael Vick, the suspended N.F.L. quarterback, on state dogfighting charges has been delayed. The Surry County Commonwealth attorney’s office in Virginia said the trial, originally set for April 2, would be rescheduled March 25.Vick is serving a 23-month prison term in Leavenworth, Kan., after pleading guilty to federal charges. Officials had already delayed the trials of his co-defendants, Quanis Phillips and Purnell Peace.
